01:00 <amon> Question: if I turn off Registration rights for All and turn it on only for Admin, does that accomplish the desired property of putting all user creation in the hands of the administrator?  
01:07 <lucaa> has quit  
01:18 <@sdumitriu> Don't forget about Guest  
01:21 <amon> hmm? Is that enabled by default?  
01:24 <amon> My goal as you probably guessed is for an Enterprise type setup for a small distributed company. Only staff may be allowed access; staff are in groups such that someone working on a proposal doesn't necessarily have access to Finance documents, etc.  
01:25 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
02:10 <DrLou> has quit  
02:58 <lucaa> has quit  
03:16 <amon> How do I modify user passwords? I used ones that were too long the first time through and now I've got 12 user accounts that are no good and I cannot seem to get at a user panel to make the changes.  
03:20 <amon> The ability for the administrator to change a password is a fairly common need anyway, ie in case of a security breach, that I need to know how in general so I might as well learn now.  
03:21 <amon> One way I found was to delete the user and recreate them, but that might have side effects I don't want in a live environment.  
03:22 <amon> Might also note that an 18 character limit on pass phrases is a bit short these days. I often use double that or even more.  
03:54 <amon> When I select a user and the select preferences where the password should be, it just kicks me back to the menu panel but with a title: Administration: admin.${crtItemId} which looks to me like a bug.  
03:59 <amon> Yep, side effects of deleting and recreating a user to change the password are messy. I was not surprised to find it removes them from all groups, etc.  
04:12 <amon> Interesting... I seem to have got to the password change through a different pathway...  
04:30 <amon> Okay. If I am logged in as Admin and I click on the User name and the Preferences, I can change the password; if I instead clickon the "manage' icon, the pencil, and then click on preferences, I get kicked out. Looks like a bug to me.  
05:27 <@sdumitriu> amon: There should be no limit on the password length  
05:28 <@sdumitriu> Since it's a hash, you could put megabytes of length and it would still fit  
05:28 <@sdumitriu> And it should be possible to change the password of another user  
05:28 <@sdumitriu> Worst case, directly from the object editor on the user's profile
